intro: Alyxia efatensis, commonly known as the Efaté hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Efate in Vanuatu. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a yellow throat. It thrives in coastal and disturbed habitats, often growing in sunny, well-drained soils. Alyxia efatensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists studying tropical flora.
